ygData.subject: Re: Skill Changes
ygData.msgSnippet: Sean, perhaps your correct in your mathmatics... It would be over 1000 hours... But I don ;t think the average player is going to spend 20 hours a week and
ygData.messageBody:
Sean, perhaps your correct in your mathmatics... It would be over 1000
hours... But I don';t think the 'average' player is going to spend 20 hours
a week and only get 1-2 levels either... In fact, I reached level 5 in about
4 hours as I recall... It's the other 17 (I am now 22) that took me the
better part of 400+ hours to reach... but that is by my CHOICE! Because I
wanted to spend time chatting with others, selling stuff, making stuff and
just plain exploring places... And guess what... I still do all that! I
probably don't actually play 20 hours a week, more like 15 I would guess...
and I probably gain 1.5 levels in that time... So, it would be more like 750
hours to make level 50... But that is not the case either I would bet, not
for me anyway...

Oh, and I know MANY others that play regularly (daily) for at least 4 hours
per session... that would give them at least 28 hours per week... which is
why they (my friends) are 3-7 levels above me even though we started out
about the same time...

Besides, who cares?!?! This is the way that *I* like to play!! If you
want to be some *power-leveler* then go for it!! Crank up those levels as
fast as you can!

I think Verant did the right thing in making it easy to level up in the
BEGINNING, and harder to make levels later on... Sure, it's frustrating, but
that is the way of the world of Norrath!

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild - www.platinumsphere.com

> From: Sean.Clark@...
>
> I think the point that was being made is that some of us (a lot?) have
other
> commitments outside of being brain-sucked by a computer game - spouses,
> children, career commitments, school, whatever - that make it impossible
for
> us to play 20 hours a week.
> You said you were originally thinking it would take you a year to reach
> level 50 at 20 hours a week. Reality check : THAT'S over 1000 HOURS of
> your time to finish playing a GAME.
> Most people in this country don't spend 2000 hours in a YEAR making enough
> money to live.
> Yikes, scary to me that anybody would spend that much time playing a
> game....but I digress....if you want to spend the time (and/or if you HAVE
> that much time to spend!) I guess its your prerogative...but for a lot of
us
> that just isn't possible.
> I have been fairly satisfied with the rate of my level progression, but I
> would be happier if it were a LITTLE bit faster. It seems that the best
way
> to balance the game between Evercrack junkies and the more casual gamer
are
> additions and add-ons for higher levels (which Verant is working on), and
a
> faster rate of level progression overall.
> Just my 2 coppers worth.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Lemac Justerian [mailto:lemac@...]
> Sent: Monday, July 26, 1999 6:00 PM
> To: EQCheats@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Skill Changes
>
>
> From: "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...>
>
> You think that 8-10 hours is "a bit much" to gain a level?? I play about
20
> hours a week (on average) and gain about 1-2 levels, which is about
right...
> if it was half that, then instead of being a level 22 now, I would
probably
> already be up to 50!
>
> I kinda thought that most people level up pretty fast myself... hehe...
Who
> would have thought that just 3 months into this online game we would have
> Level 50 players, and 4 months in, that we would have TONS of them, and
many
> more level 40+ players!!
>
> I really didn't expect to reach level 50 for about a year (at 20 hrs a
week
> that is about right too, it seems) so I think things are pretty good
> myself... I know many people are more interested in leveling up as fast as
> they can, but tell me, what do you do after you have reached level 50 and
> have played at that level for a month or more? I think I would get pretty
> bored with it...
> Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
> Proud member of Platinum Sphere Guild - www.platinumsphere.com
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Doug Sorensen <belgarth_of_surefall@...>
> To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
> Sent: Monday, July 26, 1999 3:30 PM
> Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Skill Changes
>
>
> > From: Doug Sorensen <belgarth_of_surefall@...>
> >
> > eqfeedback@... is the email address for
> > feedback.
> >
> > I agree that level gaining is quite slow. 8-10 hours
> > for a level is a bit much. I can't imagine the high
> > 30s and above.
> >
> > Belgarth
> >
> > --- "Fling, Kirby" <FlingKirby@...> wrote:
> > > From: "Fling, Kirby" <FlingKirby@...>
> > >
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > >If Verant moves too far down this road EQ will
> > > whither and
> > > >die just like DR is. Then we will move on to the
> > > next game
> > > >until it gets too difficult to be fun anymore.
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > >
> > > You have also hit that nail right on the head. I am
> > > only a casual player,
> > > and there have been many patches where I've felt a
> > > bit shafted. They have
> > > made EQ into a beast that requires absurd amounts of
> > > time to make any
> > > progress whatsoever. I used to have a great group
> > > of people to party with,
> > > but I couldn't dedicate the 40+ hours per week that
> > > they did, so I'm enough
> > > levels behind that I can't group with them and make
> > > any progress... so I'm
> > > stuck at a mid level and I haven't been able to find
> > > another decent group
> > > for the life of me. So instead of facing all the
> > > frustration, I'm wishing I
> > > could just switch my characters to "inactive"
> > > status... where I can't play
> > > the game, but they don't delete my characters.... so
> > > I can come back in a
> > > year or so if nothing better comes along.
> > >
> > > On the flip side, if EQ was just 50% easier, you
> > > wouldn't be able to pry me
> > > away from that infernal compter. It's the
> > > excitement of making progress
> > > that is so fun, and for the casual gamer, the
> > > progress curve in EQ is so low
> > > after lvl 20 that it's just not that much fun
> > > anymore. I'd almost rather
> > > spend my time playing Kingdoms or go back and play
> > > Bladur's Gate all the way
> > > through, or best of all... go find a good text-based
> > > MUD where I can advance
> > > at a reasonable speed then wiz and start adding my
> > > own imagination to the
> > > world.
> > >
> > > -Kzak
> > >
> > > P.S. does anybody know a email address for feedback?
> > > I'd love to just share
> > > some of these frustrations.
> >
> > --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
